name: sind
description: A simple, interactive, list-friendly dialog for Bash 4+.
contribution_justification:
Please ensure your pull request adheres to the following guidelines:
 
 
- **Lint with [shellcheck](https://www.shellcheck.net/)**. This is done on push, but doing so while developing helps minimize senseless builds which are a waste of resources.
- **[Open an issue](https://github.com/l3laze/sind/issues) before creating any new features**, for discussion.
- Bug fixes & POSIX-friendly changes are more than welcome!
- Check your spelling and grammar (if applicable).
- Try to use a text editor that will remove trailing whitespace, or configure git to do so.
- Run `visual-test.sh` to confirm visual output of tests is proper.

name: Data Stewardship Wizard
description: Data Stewards capture and combine their knowledge and expertise with respect to the specific needs of a domain or an organisation. Researchers are truly guided through composing a DMP which can be then exported using selected template and format, including machine-actionable. The benefit lies not only in having a nowadays often obligatory DMP for funders but mainly learning how to handle data correctly, make them FAIR, maintain them well during the project, and curate them long-term.
contribution_justification: https://github.com/ds-wizard/ds-wizard (then in each repository per app/component)
contribution_requirements_justification:
General information is in the technical documentation: https://guide.ds-wizard.org/miscellaneous/development/contributing

Each repository may define own guidelines and conventions in addition, if not, no constraints are applied and eventual issues will be solved in the pull request discussions upon code review.
license_location_justification:
https://github.com/ds-wizard/engine-backend/blob/develop/LICENSE.md
https://github.com/ds-wizard/engine-frontend/blob/develop/LICENSE
https://github.com/ds-wizard/document-worker/blob/develop/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: All repositories of DSW contain LICENSE file with Apache 2.0 license. The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: https://guide.ds-wizard.org (linked from README files in repositories)
documentation_interface_justification:
Each deployment have its own generated Swagger UI documentation, e.g., https://api.demo.ds-wizard.org/swagger-ui
This is explained in the documentation.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: All DSW projects use semantic versioning and git flow. Bug fixes are released using patch versions. Before releasing a version, a release candidate (X.Y.Z-RC.n) version is released for testing (including our E2E test suite).
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification:
All projects are using semantic versioning, all components have matching major and minor version (patch may differ on bug fixes), e.g., see https://github.com/ds-wizard/engine-frontend/tags
Commit ID is also usable as an unique version identifier.
version_tags_justification:
Git tags are used, matching tags are then used for Docker images.
https://github.com/ds-wizard/engine-backend/tags
https://github.com/ds-wizard/engine-frontend/tags
https://github.com/ds-wizard/document-worker/tags
release_notes_justification: Release notes are kept for a project as a whole for easier maintenance and readability (no need to check all repositories what changes in each component, sometimes it is related together sometimes not): https://guide.ds-wizard.org/miscellaneous/development/roadmap
report_tracker_justification:
https://github.com/ds-wizard/ds-wizard/issues (for bug report, questions, and feature requests)
Then JIRA is used for planning and prioritization: https://ds-wizard.atlassian.net
report_responses_justification: Reported bugs are fixed usually in the upcoming release (based on severity). Critical bugs are fixes using hotfix release (patch version).
vulnerability_report_process_justificati: The process is described here https://guide.ds-wizard.org/miscellaneous/development/vulnerabilities together with lists of known and solved vulnerabilities
vulnerability_report_private_justificati: Private vulnerability issues can be reported using e-mail as described in https://guide.ds-wizard.org/miscellaneous/development/vulnerabilities and on GitHub issues
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: For publicly reported vulnerabilities, it is possible to check them: https://github.com/ds-wizard/ds-wizard/issues?q=label%3AVulnerability+
build_justification: All projects are using GitHub Actions to build, test, and eventually release the component.
build_common_tools_justification: Common tools are used for building (e.g., frontend uses npm, backend uses stack and GHC).
test_justification: In addition to backend tests, we use E2E Cypress test suite: https://github.com/ds-wizard/dsw-e2e-tests
test_invocation_justification: Backend tests are invocable by "stack test". E2E tests in a standard way for Cypress or by simply using the Makefile.
test_most_justification: Most of the use cases (all critical) are covered in the E2E tests.
tests_are_added_justification: It is possible to check it by browsing commits in repositories and the E2E test suite.
warnings_justification:
We enable and check warnings:
- Backend app: GHC warnings and HLint linter, both used in CI workflows
- Frontend app: Elm compiler and elm-analyse
- Document worker: mypy (typing for Python) and Flake8
warnings_fixed_justification: The warnings and issues reported by linters causing some of CI workflows to fail - such code won't be merged.
warnings_strict_justification: As much warnings as possible and that are reasonable for the project are used.
know_secure_design_justification: All primary developers (MarekSuchanek, vknaisl, janslifka) has master degree in software engineering and completed several software security courses covering the topics of Secure Software Development Fundamentals: https://github.com/orgs/ds-wizard/people
know_common_errors_justification: As above, all primary developers (MarekSuchanek, vknaisl, janslifka) completed several software security courses coveringalso the common errors and vulnerabilities in software: https://github.com/orgs/ds-wizard/people
crypto_published_justification: Using the well-known protocols and algorithms only (SHA, AES, HS)
crypto_call_justification: No custom cryptography is included, we are relying on libraries (Haskell), mainly Cryptonite: https://hackage.haskell.org/package/cryptonite
delivery_mitm_justification: HTTPS communication is recommended (and used in our deployments)
static_analysis_justification:
For all components, we use "Code Style" workflow in GitHub Actions CI:
- Backend app uses HLint (linter) and hindent (correct indentation, newlines etc.)
- Frontend app uses elm-analyse (directly part of testing, build CI)
- Document Worker uses Flake8 (style and linting) and mypy (typing)
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: For document worker, we use CodeQL (https://github.com/ds-wizard/document-worker/blob/develop/.github/workflows/codeql-analysis.yml). Unfortunately, for Elm nor Haskell are such tools available. But we also use dependabot to report updates and vulnerabilities in dependencies.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: Such vulnerabilities are added to https://guide.ds-wizard.org/miscellaneous/development/vulnerabilities (where information about fix also appears).
static_analysis_often_justification:
All static code analysis is set using GitHub Actions (on push):
https://github.com/ds-wizard/engine-backend/tree/develop/.github/workflows
https://github.com/ds-wizard/engine-frontend/tree/develop/.github/workflows
https://github.com/ds-wizard/document-worker/tree/develop/.github/workflows
dynamic_analysis_justification: The use of OWASP ZAP is mentioned in the https://guide.ds-wizard.org/miscellaneous/development/contributing#test-policy.
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: Both Haskell and Python have its garbage collector
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: Backend component is tested with many assertions (expectations). All components together are tested using E2E test suite.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: Such vulnerabilities are added to https://guide.ds-wizard.org/miscellaneous/development/vulnerabilities (where information about fix also appears).
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: All repositories use GitHub Actions to build and eventually test the code. It also builds and pushes a Docker image for simple testing and staging deployment. These Docker images can be also used within the E2E test suite that verifies functionality and compatibility of all components.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification: All communication on GitHub including commit messages, code comments, and documentation including website is in English.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".

report_archive_justification: Kratos uses the GitHub issue tracker, which works as an archive: https://github.com/ory/kratos/issues
build_floss_tools_justification: Go is licensed under MIT License: https://golang.org/LICENSE
test_justification: Kratos uses Go for running automated tests, which is a FLOSS project: https://golang.org/LICENSE
test_invocation_justification: Kratos uses Go for running automated tests https://github.com/ory/kratos/blob/master/README.md#running-tests
test_most_justification: Test coverage can be viewed at coveralls: https://coveralls.io/github/ory/kratos?branch=master
know_secure_design_justification: Kratos is maintained by Aeneas Rekkas: https://github.com/arekkas
know_common_errors_justification: Kratos is maintained by Aeneas Rekkas: https://github.com/arekkas
crypto_published_justification: Kratos uses crypto libraries from the Go standard library.
crypto_call_justification: Kratos uses crypto libraries from the Go standard library.
crypto_floss_justification: Kratos uses crypto libraries from the Go standard library.
crypto_keylength_justification: Kratos uses AES-128, SHA-256, 256 ECDSA, 4096 RSA
static_analysis_justification: Unfortunately, no good AST tool exists for golang. The only popular one (gast / go-ast) has bugs that prevent it from being used for Kratos.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: Kratos uses CircleCI for continous integration https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/ory/kratos
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification:
https://www.ory.sh/kratos/docs/next/
You can open issues/bug reports on the GitHub repository in English.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.

name: Code Server Boilerplates Starter Pack GitHub Template
description: An starter repo contains the base Dokerfile from https://github.com/cdr/deploy-code-server, on-push and on-release image builds
description_good_justification: Deploying an development environment and code-server with only using Docker
interact_justification: Contributing guide and how to submit feedback is still WIP though usage docs are within the README.
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/code-server-boilerplates/starter-pack/blob/main/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Some documentation basics file contents found. We may also move the docs directory into an seperate docs repository to avoid clutter.
documentation_interface_justification: While this Docker container uses code-server as its base image, we don't produce software based on it.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Documentation for this is still work in progress.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: We use semver for the releases, and since we're still at version 0, things might break as usual.
version_tags_justification: Since we use GitHub Releases for that, Git tags are either created locally and then pushed or at release creation time.
release_notes_vulns_justification: Since this GitHub template-slash-Docker image is only typically updated the bundled software at build time, this is not applicable.
report_tracker_justification: We use GitHub issues for that.
report_archive_justification: Since we use GitHub for the issue tracker at https://github.com/code-server-boilerplates/starter-pack/issues, they're searchable and available publicly unless otherwise stated by the maintainers.
build_justification: We build the Docker images using Buildkit for amd64 and arm64 architectures.
test_justification: We usually run build tests with "docker build" and optionally use the Dive CLI to check for wasted space.
test_invocation_justification: We don't know about that on Docker images, for now.
test_policy_justification: Documentation for this will be written soon.
tests_are_added_justification: No testing policies as of time of writing.
tests_documented_added_justification: No documentation for that as of time of writing.
know_secure_design_justification: While we're not primary developers of code-server, we try to follow the best practices in writing Dockerfiles and other scripts as much as possible
crypto_published_justification: We use OpenSSL to generate an randomly-generated password if the GENERATE_PASSWORD variable is set to true. Otherwise, the code-server binary should handle it.
delivery_mitm_justification: Docker images are distributed through HTTPS.
static_analysis_justification: We use ShellCheck to check for possible issues on shell scripts and an Dockerfile linter for that.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification: We require bug reports and we write documentation in English.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
dco_justification: We implement this through the DCO (https://developercertificate.org/).
bus_factor_justification: We're currently looking for other maintainers.
documentation_architecture_justification: We don't build the software, instead we consume them by preinstalling into the Docker image.
documentation_current_justification: We don't add version-based docs yet.

name: Capact
description: Simple way to manage applications and infrastructure.
contribution_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/capactio/capact/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/capactio/capact/blob/main/LICENSE>.

floss_license_osi_justification: The Apache-2.0 license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: // No documentation basics file(s) found.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
report_tracker_justification: We are using GitHub for tracking individual issues
report_process_justification: We accept issues and bug reports on GitHub https://github.com/capactio/capact/issues
report_archive_justification: GitHub stores the history of all created and closed issues, e.g. https://github.com/capactio/capact/issues/332
warnings_justification: We use Golangci-lint to lint our code, which is a FLOSS tool. It integrates with popular text editors or IDEs like vim, VSCode or GoLand. We are also running the linter on continous integration.
warnings_fixed_justification: We are running the linter on every pull request to ensure that any new code is compliant to our coding standards. Example: https://github.com/capactio/capact/runs/2880192195?check_suite_focus=true
delivery_mitm_justification: HTTPS is used for the delivery mechanism to the application. We have cert-manager integrated, to allow generation of TLS certificates.
static_analysis_often_justification: We are running the static analysis on every commit on the main branch: https://github.com/capactio/capact/blob/9f8b49dd27e1c72a5c75389c2a1228f03643204f/.github/workflows/branch-build.yaml#L39
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: We are using GitHub Action to implement continuous integration: https://github.com/capactio/capact/actions. We are running the CI on all pull requests and when committing to the main branch. Integration tests are also run every few hours on a dedicated environment.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.

test_justification: Automated tests are quite difficult for an OS. No FLOSS testing suites exist to my knowledge. However sanitizers are used, and CI tests (for building and compilation) are available.
tests_are_added_justification: More tests are added for the build and compilation steps, and userspace tests are planned for syscalls and such.
warnings_justification: UBSAN is used in Nettapus. -Wall, -Wextra, -pedantic are also enabled at all times, and warnings are fixed immediately.
dynamic_analysis_justification: A syscall fuzzer is planned, but not used yet.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: All discovered vulnerabilities will be fixed as soon as possible.
general_comments: This is a fairly new project.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
english_justification: Although currently minimal, all proper documentation is - and will be - provided in English.
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.
